title: Bentley Charges $68,000 for This Stunning Paint Fade
description: Bentley is always looking to push the limits of hand craftsmanship, and sometimes one exquisite paint finish isn't enough. The automaker debuted its Ombré color-fade paint finish on a Continental GT coupe at Monterey Car Week last month, using a time-consuming process to create a fade effect that ...
titleSummary: Luxury Brand's Breathtaking "Color Gradation" Comes with a Hefty Price Tag
descriptionSummary: Bentley continues to elevate traditional craftsmanship with innovative techniques. At this year's Monterey Car Week, the brand showcased an exclusive Ombré-inspired paint finish on a Continental GT coupe, achieved through a painstakingly detailed application process.

title: Whiskey Meets Speed: Cadillac F1 Strikes Blockbuster Deal with Jim Beam Before 2026 Debut
description: Cadillac’s long-anticipated Formula 1 debut in 2026 just got a shot of American heritage. The automaker confirmed a multi-year partnership with Jim Beam, making the bourbon distiller its official spirits partner. For Cadillac, the move reinforces its identity as a proudly American ...
titleSummary: Cadillac's F1 Racer Scores a High-Octane Partnership with Jim Beam for Upcoming Debut
descriptionSummary: Cadillac's F1 entry gets an injection of All-American spirit. The luxury carmaker has partnered with iconic bourbon brand Jim Beam in a multi-year deal that bolsters its patriotic image ahead of its 2026 debut on the Formula 1 circuit.

title: Toyota's New App Predicts When You'll Forget to Charge, and Fixes It
description: Toyota's ChargeMinder prototype app tackles the biggest challenge facing plug-in hybrid electric vehicle (PHEV) owners, which is remembering to charge their cars in the first place. Using behavioral science and real-time vehicle data, the app delivers just-in-time charging reminders that appear ...
titleSummary: "Smartphone Assistant Alerts Drivers to Low Battery, Sends Charging Reminder"
descriptionSummary: Toyota's innovative ChargeMinder app uses advanced technology and behavioral insights to help plug-in hybrid drivers stay on top of their vehicles' energy needs, sending timely reminders to ensure they never forget a crucial charge.

title: Mayor Pushes Button to Crush Seized Dodge Durango Hellcat
description: Street takeovers have been a big problem in some places, leading to injuries, property damage, and a whole load of other issues. One strategy police have relied on to combat the takeovers is to post photos of seized vehicles on social media as a warning to others, but police in Louisville, Kentucky ...
titleSummary: "Mayor Demolishes Record-Breaking Muscle Car in Daring Public Display of Law Enforcement"
descriptionSummary: In recent years, street takeovers have sparked concerns over safety and property damage in various cities. A tactic employed by some law enforcement agencies involves publicly showcasing impounded vehicles from these events as a deterrent, but one department is exploring alternative approaches.

title: Stellantis Looks To Snoopy To Increase Chrysler Pacifica Sales
description: Chrysler is betting that nostalgia and family-friendly charm can move the sales needle in a minivan segment that has steadily shrunk under the weight of crossovers and SUVs. Rather than revisiting its own history, Chrysler is borrowing a cultural icon with nearly universal recognition. The ...
titleSummary: Pacifica Gets Peanuts Push: Chrysler Counts on Beloved Cartoon Character for Boost
descriptionSummary: Chrysler is counting on a winning formula: nostalgia and family appeal. To revitalize its minivan sales, the brand has turned to an unmistakable cultural symbol that transcends generations.

description: Every so often, a car surfaces that even seasoned Bentley enthusiasts have to look twice at. titleSummary: "Rare Find: '92 Bentley Estate Seeks New Home After Decades of Low-Mileage Use"
descriptionSummary: A rare gem that has even die-hard Bentley aficionados doing double takes: the 1992 Val D'Isere. This bespoke shooting brake, born from a Turbo R base and commissioned by the Sultan of Brunei, boasts a unique blend of style and all-wheel-drive prowess.

title: Flying Cars Prove They Can Crash Just Like Regular Ones
description: Two flying cars crashed into each other during a rehearsal for an airshow in northeastern China on Tuesday, injuring one pilot and forcing one vehicle to the ground, where it caught fire. The collision occurred in Changchun as the city prepared for its five-day airshow, with both eVTOL vehicles ...
titleSummary: "Airborne Autos Fail to Escape Gravity of Crashes"
descriptionSummary: A dramatic rehearsal crash took place in northeastern China's Changchun, leaving a pilot injured and one flying car engulfed in flames after colliding mid-air during an airshow warm-up.

title: Toyota GR Corolla 2.0? Japan Gets the Tougher, Cooler Hot Hatch First
description: The Toyota GR Corolla is already one of the most hardcore hot hatches on the market, but Toyota isn’t standing still. The automaker confirmed that a partially upgraded model will launch in Japan on November 3, 2025, focusing on rigidity, cooling, and durability learned directly from ...

descriptionSummary: Toyota's GR Corolla has already earned its place as one of the most extreme hot hatches available, but Toyota is pushing it further. A revised version debuts in Japan on November 3, 2025, with refinements centered around enhanced structural integrity, cooling performance, and long-term durability.

title: The Eclipse Cross EV: Mitsubishi’s French Connection Could Sneak Renault Back to America
description: The Eclipse name still stirs debate among enthusiasts. Once a sporty coupe, it now lives on as a compact crossover, one of the few models that Mitsubishi continues to sell in the United States – a polarizing move, but a necessary one for the brand to survive. descriptionSummary: The Eclipse name remains a contentious topic among car enthusiasts, as it evolves from a sporty coupe to a compact crossover - a bold transition that's helped Mitsubishi stay relevant in the US market.

title: Volkswagen Plots Electric ID.Touareg as Successor to the Iconic SUV
description: Long after its discontinuation in the United States, the Volkswagen Touareg is slated for the chopping block next year. But the SUV's name could live on attached to a new all-electric model, according to a report from German publication Automobilwoche. Whether this new incarnation of the Touareg ...

descriptionSummary: A reportedly electric successor to the Volkswagen Touareg is in the works, potentially reviving the iconic nameplate despite its parent SUV's impending demise. The new vehicle could mark an exciting reboot for the brand next year.

title: Nissan Leaf Is Already in Trouble Before It Even Arrives
description: The third-generation Leaf is one of the models that Nissan counts on to help steer the company back to stability. After years of shrinking global sales and heavy losses, the automaker needs a hit in the electric-vehicle space to stay competitive. The latest Leaf makes a strong case on paper. It ...
titleSummary: "Electric Dream Turns into Nightmare for Nissan's Highly Anticipated New Model"
descriptionSummary: Nissan's third-generation Leaf is crucial for the brand's recovery, following years of declining sales and financial struggles. This revamped model offers a compelling proposition in the electric vehicle market. Its impressive specs provide a promising start.

title: Mazda’s New CX-30 Update Proves Small Changes Make a Big Difference
description: The Mazda CX-30 is the entry-level model in the brand's SUV lineup, a position that has become increasingly critical as vehicle prices continue to rise across the industry. Compact crossovers like the CX-30 give buyers a way into the SUV segment without stretching their budget, but the segment has ...
titleSummary: "CX-30 Upgrade Shows That Incremental Improvements Can Add Up to Something Substantial"
descriptionSummary: As premium prices soar, compact crossovers like the Mazda CX-30 have emerged as a gateway to the SUV market, offering an affordable entry point for buyers seeking the versatility and style of a larger vehicle without breaking the bank.

title: Tesla’s New 7-Year Warranty Helps Owners—Unless You Bought a Cybertruck
description: Tesla has added additional warranty coverage beyond its existing new-vehicle and battery warranties. The new "High-Priced Propulsion-Related Part Warranty" includes seven years or 70,000 miles of coverage (whichever comes first) for powertrain-related components not covered by Tesla's existing ...
titleSummary: "Tesla's Extended Warranty Boosts Peace of Mind for Most Drivers, Except Cybertruck Owners"
descriptionSummary: Tesla is expanding its warranty program to include enhanced protection for costly propulsion system parts, offering a new seven-year or 70,000-mile warranty that kicks in after the standard vehicle and battery warranties expire.

title: Tesla Quietly Ends Cheapest Cybertruck: Why You Won’t Miss It
description: The Tesla Cybertruck Long Range Rear-Wheel Drive (RWD), the model’s least-expensive variant and the one most troubled from the start, has disappeared from the automaker’s online configurator. When Tesla CEO Elon Musk unveiled the Cybertruck in 2019, he stated that drivers could soon purchase a ...

descriptionSummary: Tesla's base Cybertruck model, initially met with skepticism, has been quietly removed from its online configurator. This move comes after Elon Musk first showcased the vehicle in 2019, highlighting its affordability and performance potential.

title: Owners Warned: Alfa Romeo Giulia, Stelvio at Risk of Sudden Power Loss
description: Stellantis is recalling 53,849 Alfa Romeo vehicles in the United States after federal safety regulators flagged a defect in their fuel delivery modules (FDMs) that can cause the engine to suddenly lose power. The affected vehicles are 2017–2018 Alfa Romeo Giulia ...

descriptionSummary: Alfa Romeo is issuing a recall for 53,849 vehicles in the US due to faulty fuel delivery systems that can lead to sudden engine stalls. Affected models include select 2017-2018 Giulias and possibly other year makes within this timeframe.

title: Tesla Model Y Owners Forced to Smash Windows After Door Handles Fail
description: Tesla is facing another safety investigation, this time over the very feature that lets you into the car. titleSummary: "Tesla Model Y Owners Frustrated by Flawed Doors That Refuse to Open"
descriptionSummary: Regulators are scrutinizing Tesla's electric vehicles after receiving complaints about malfunctioning door handles, particularly in the Model Y, which has sparked worries over the reliability and safety of these popular cars.

title: Audi CEO Says Electric Cars Are “The Better Technology”
description: Audi CEO Gernot Döllner is doubling down on electric vehicles. In a recent interview, he argued that EVs are not just about emissions targets, but represent the superior form of automotive technology overall. “Beyond climate protection, the electric car is simply the better technology,” Döllner ...
titleSummary: "Electric Vehicles Emerge as Top Choice for Audi's Future Roadmap"
descriptionSummary: Audi's CEO Gernot Döllner is solidifying his commitment to electric vehicles, viewing them as a leap forward in automotive innovation that outshines traditional gasoline-powered cars on multiple fronts.

title: Which Are the Best Cars, Trucks and SUVs of 2025? NACTOY Just Named Its Semifinalists

descriptionSummary: In the vast American automotive market, consumers face a daunting decision-making process when selecting their next ride. With over 100 new vehicles hitting the scene in 2025 alone, expert guidance is invaluable for making an informed choice.

title: The Porsche Family Sedan That's So Fast It Needs a Parachute
description: The Porsche Taycan Turbo GT has been “banned” from Australian drag strips for exceeding the International Hot Rod Association's 150mph speed limit. The IHRA sanctions competitions at most major Australian drag strips and requires all vehicles exceeding this threshold to be fitted with parachutes. ...
titleSummary: "Ferrari of Family Cars Packs Punch with Thrilling Performance, Aerial Assist"
descriptionSummary: The Porsche Taycan Turbo GT has fallen foul of Australia's speed limits, prohibited from competing in sanctioned drag events due to its impressive top-end velocity far surpassing the 150mph IHRA safety threshold.

title: Mazda CX-50 Gets Welcome Price Cuts as CX-5 Prepares US Arrival
description: The Mazda CX-50 has been positioned as the more rugged, outdoorsy alternative to the CX-5, with premium touches and adventure‐ready styling. That positioning may be under pressure now that Mazda has revealed the all-new 2026 CX-5, which brings a lot of upgrades in design, comfort, and tech. As ...
titleSummary: Mazda Sharpens CX-50 Deal with Discounts Ahead of CX-5's Stateside Debut
descriptionSummary: Mazda's rugged CX-50 was poised to reign supreme for outdoor enthusiasts, but the introduction of an upgraded 2026 CX-5 threatens to shake up that distinction with its elevated design, comfort, and cutting-edge technology.

title: GM Stops Building the Very Trucks Americans Are Buying Most
description: In the first half of 2025, the Chevrolet Colorado ranked among the top-selling midsize trucks in the US. Data covering January through June shows that Chevy moved 52,815 Corolados, a 26 percent rise over the same period in 2024, while its more luxurious cousin, the GMC Canyon, posted 18,339 sales, ...
titleSummary: "GM Shifts Focus Away from Best-Selling Models Amid Changing Consumer Tastes"
descriptionSummary: The Chevrolet Colorado was a midsize truck leader in early 2025, with sales of nearly 53,000 units between January and June, marking a significant 26% increase from the same period in 2024. Its premium counterpart, the GMC Canyon, sold around 18,300 vehicles during this time.

title: Ford’s $2B EV Factory Already Cutting 1,000 Jobs
description: Ford plans to eliminate up to 1,000 jobs at its Cologne, Germany, plant, reports German news agency DPA. The historic manufacturing site was recently converted into an all-EV factory, and the report cites slowing EV demand in Europe as a reason for the cuts. But Ford has also been planning on ...
titleSummary: Ford's Electric Dream Shifts into Reverse Amid Layoffs at $2 Billion Plant
descriptionSummary: Ford's Cologne plant is facing significant job reductions, reportedly up to 1,000 positions, following its transition to an electric vehicle production site. Slowing European EV demand is cited among reasons behind the cuts, along with broader restructuring plans.

title: Has Screen Fever Peaked? Hyundai Thinks Cars Need Fewer Displays
description: Unveiled at the recent IAA Mobility Show in Munich, the Hyundai Concept Three is a compact electric hatchback previewing a more affordable EV from the Korean automaker (albeit one that might not make it to the United States). The concept's interior also minimizes screens, an approach designers ...
titleSummary: "Hyundai Takes Aim at Tech Overload in New Car Design Philosophy"
descriptionSummary: Hyundai unveiled its futuristic Concept Three at the IAA Mobility Show in Munich. This sleek compact electric hatchback hints at a more budget-friendly EV model from Hyundai, possibly with international availability except in the US.

title: Last Pre-Audi Lamborghini Concept Could Fetch $4 Million
description: All things considered, Lamborghini has done well under the stewardship of Audi, which has been in charge of the Italian automaker since its purchase by the Volkswagen Group in 1998. Audi's technical expertise and VW's money have made Lambos faster and more reliable, while also allowing the ...
titleSummary: "Rare Lamborghini Showstopper Set to Sell for a Pricey $4 Million"
descriptionSummary: Under Audi's oversight since its acquisition by the Volkswagen Group in 1998, Lamborghini has flourished. Combining Audi's engineering prowess with VW's resources has resulted in significantly improved performance and reliability from these Italian supercars.

title: Lexus Has Just Introduced the Most Glamorous SUV Ever
description: The Lexus LX has long balanced two worlds: the rugged dependability inherited from its Toyota Land Cruiser 300 roots and the elegance that defines the Lexus brand. It is the model buyers choose when they need genuine off-road capability wrapped in leather and wood trim. That mix of toughness and ...
titleSummary: "Luxury Meets Adventure in Lexus's Newest High-End Off-Road Luxury Vehicle"
descriptionSummary: The Lexus LX seamlessly blends a rugged, dependable foundation with refined luxury amenities, catering to drivers seeking uncompromising off-road prowess paired with premium comfort features like supple leather and rich wood accents.

title: Final 2016 BMW M4 GTS With 305 Miles Listed for $1 Million
description: The 2016 BMW M4 GTS represented Munich's most focused track weapon, a limited-production masterpiece that bridged the gap between road car and race machine. BMW produced just 803 examples globally, with only 300 originally earmarked for the United States. Now, the final M4 GTS ever produced, #803 ...

descriptionSummary: Here is a revised description of the article: BMW's ultra-exclusive 2016 M4 GTS was a purpose-built performance icon that merged street-smart sophistication with the ferocity of a racing machine. Only 300 were destined for American roads, and now we meet the last one ever made - #803.

title: U.S. Slashes Tariffs on Japanese Cars to 15% Amid Global Trade Shifts
description: The U.S. will lower tariffs on Japanese automobiles and auto parts to 15% starting today, September 16, 2025, down from the previous 27.5% rate. The move is part of a broader trade realignment between Washington and Tokyo, and one that could reshape competitive dynamics across the global auto ...
titleSummary: "Washington Cuts Auto Duties with Japan, a Move Reflecting Broader Trade Rethinking"
descriptionSummary: The US has begun reducing tariffs on Japanese autos and components to 15%, effective September 16, marking a significant shift in bilateral trade relations with Japan and potentially redefining the global automotive landscape.

title: Toyota Says Diesel Could Be Dead in 10 Years as Hydrogen Looms
description: Toyota is suggesting that the days of diesel are numbered. Speaking in Australia, sales and marketing vice president Sean Hanley explained that the fuel which has long powered the country’s most popular utes and SUVs might have only another ten years left before hydrogen technology begins to take ...
titleSummary: "Diesel's Demise Looms, Replaced by Hydrogen Power within a Decade"
descriptionSummary: Toyota hints at a diesel decline, predicting that the once-dominant fuel will fade in popularity over the next decade as hydrogen power emerges as a viable alternative for Australia's truck and SUV drivers.

title: Corvette C8 Owners Report Cars Bursting Into Flames at Gas Stations
description: The eighth-generation Chevy Corvette is an impressive car in all its forms, but it’s not perfect, and some owners are finding that out the hard way. titleSummary: "Flames Engulf Corvette 8s at Fuel Stops: A Growing Safety Concern Emerges"

title: Sunrise Yellow Beast: 2026 Subaru WRX Series.Yellow Unveiled

title: Polestar 2 Successor Locked In With a Long Wait Ahead
description: Polestar's first standalone model, the Polestar 2, has been the brand's anchor ever since its debut earlier this decade. It was initially thought to be a Volvo product, but later evolved into Polestar's very first dedicated EV, becoming a benchmark for the company's clean, understated design ...
titleSummary: "Polestar's Next Chapter Takes Shape, But Patience Will Be Required"
descriptionSummary: As Polestar's flagship model since its introduction several years ago, the Polestar 2 has set the tone for the brand's sleek and modern aesthetic, marking a departure from its Volvo roots to forge a unique identity in the electric vehicle space.

title: Toyota Recalls 591,000 Vehicles Over 12.3-Inch Dashboard Display Glitch
description: Toyota is recalling approximately 591,000 Toyota and Lexus vehicles in the U.S. after discovering that their 12.3-inch instrument panel displays may go blank at startup or while driving. The defect can wipe out critical information such as the speedometer, warning lights, and malfunction ...
titleSummary: "Massive Recall Issued for Toyota Models Over Faulty Giant Infotainment Screens"
descriptionSummary: Toyota is issuing a mass recall of around 591,000 vehicles in the US market due to an issue with their large instrument cluster screens, which may suddenly lose all visual data, including vital readouts like speed and warning indicators.

title: Museum-Quality 2023 Dodge Charger Swinger Edition for Sale With Only 22 Miles

descriptionSummary: This highly exclusive 2023 Dodge Charger Swinger Special Edition boasts an incredibly low mileage of 22 miles, making it a rare gem from Dodge's "Last Call" series, with only 1,000 examples produced worldwide.

title: W’s Affordable Golf EV Won’t Arrive Until 2028
description: The Volkswagen Golf has been the automaker's perennial global bestseller, and it also helped get VW's electrification efforts underway as the e-Golf, which was sold in the United States in limited numbers from late 2014 until 2020. A new electric Golf has been rumored for some time, but we might ...
titleSummary: Hybrid Dreams Delayed: Electric Golf Car Won't Hit the Green for Years to Come
descriptionSummary: For decades, the Volkswagen Golf has reigned supreme as VW's top global seller, with its e-Golf predecessor sparking the company's electrification push in the US market before ceasing production in 2020. A revamped electric model is reportedly on the horizon.

title: Porsche Sticks to Electric Plan for Next Boxster and Cayman

For many buyers, they represent the first step into Porsche's world of high-performance ...

descriptionSummary: The Porsche 718 Boxster and Cayman have traditionally been gateway models to the brand's performance-driven universe, delivering agile handling and unbridled driving exhilaration without the hefty price tag of a 911.

title: Ford to Demolish Its Iconic Glass House HQ After 70 Years
description: People who live in glass houses shouldn’t throw stones, perhaps. But that isn’t stopping Ford Motor Co. as it prepares to demolish the building, known as “Glass House,” that’s served as its headquarters for the last 70 years. The automaker plans to move just a mile or so away to a new building ...
titleSummary: "Ford's 70-Year Masterpiece Crumbles: Historic Glass Headquarters Faces the Wrecking Ball"
descriptionSummary: Ford is poised to raze its iconic Glass House headquarters after seven decades, despite its own history of criticism and controversy. The company will relocate a short distance away to a newly constructed facility.

title: Tesla's Risky Bet: Boost European Production While Losing Market Share
description: Tesla will increase production at its Grünheide factory near Berlin through year-end, after stronger sales boosted demand
titleSummary: "Tesla Dares to Double Down in Europe Amid Slipping Sales Lead"
descriptionSummary: Tesla plans to ramp up manufacturing at its German facility before the end of the year in response to surging sales that have driven up customer interest and orders.

title: The World’s Most Expensive Bugatti Is for Sale Again
description: There's nothing quite like the Bugatti La Voiture Noire. It's a one-off, much like today's  Brouillard, a tribute to the brand's heritage – specifically, a reminiscence of a Type 57 SC Atlantic that Jean Bugatti famously "misplaced." While that should already make for a special backstory, the La ...
titleSummary: "Supercar Sultan's Pride: Million-Dollar Bugatti Makes Rare Return to Market"
descriptionSummary: The Bugatti La Voiture Noire stands as a singular creation, echoing the spirit of its predecessor, the Type 57 SC Atlantic. This limited edition tribute marks a poignant nod to Bugatti's rich history and heritage.

title: Apple CarPlay Users Are About To Notice Huge Changes
description: Automakers are great at making vehicles, but not so good with in-car software. For many, Google’s Android Auto and Apple CarPlay bring a welcome reprieve from the infotainment platforms that are standard with every vehicle sold worldwide. With the launch of iOS 26, available on most iPhones in use ...
titleSummary: "Apple's In-Car Revolution Hits High Gear with Major Upgrades Imminent"
descriptionSummary: Most car manufacturers excel at designing vehicles, but often struggle to create user-friendly in-car software. Many drivers rely on third-party solutions like Android Auto and Apple CarPlay to enhance their driving experience. A recent iPhone update has sparked renewed interest in these systems.
